p: In monoculture treatments, the relative competitive effect of resident plants on A. altissima was primarily related to their functional group identity, whereas the species identity effect remained redundant within each functional group (Figure 2). The relative competitive index (RCI avg) of the 12 resident plants on A. altissima was significantly different among the three FGs ( F 2,31 = 22.84, p < .001), but was not significantly different within each FG (FG1: F 3,6 = 1.00, p = .4547; FG2: F 3,6 = 4.07, p = .067; and FG3: F 3,6 = 1.17, p = .3937). The highest RCI avg was for FG1 (annual plants), followed by FG2 and FG3 (mean RCI avg = 0.975, 0.710, and 0.196, respectively; Figure 2).
